questions.question: In what year was Tiberius Gracchus elected as tribune?
What did Tiberius' lex agraria do?
options: Redistribute ager publicus, reaffirm 500 iugera limit (+ 250 iugera each for two sons).
Provide land to all Romans regardless of property

questions.question: What was Tiberius' primary goal in passing the lex agraria?
options: Increase recruitment for the army (property requirement)

questions.question: Who did Tiberius take the law to in order to pass it?
How did Tiberius overcome the veto of his law?
options: He called for a new vote

questions.question: How was Tiberius going to fund implementing his law?
options: Using money from a recent conquest

questions.question: What happened when Tiberius attempted to get re-elected as Tribune?
options: A group of senators beat him to death

questions.question: In what year was Gaius Gracchus first elected Tribune?
What did Gaius do to help the poor get adequate food supply for the plebs?
options: Pass new laws to tax the wealthy

questions.question: What of Gaius' proposals was vetoed by Livius Drusus?
options: His proposal for an empire-wide military draft
His proposals for Citizenship for the Latins, and Latin status for all of Italy
His proposal to grant land to veterans

questions.question: Why did each social group fear Tiberius' proposals?
options: Senators - anger at the plebs, Equites - fear of new laws, Plebs - fear of political instability
Senators - loss of power, Equites - damage to business interests, Plebs - sharing of their benefits
Senators - fear of rebellion, Equites - loss of wealth, Plebs - more taxes
Senators - fear of military dictatorship, Equites - loss of land, Plebs - fear of poverty

questions.question: What made Gaius take up arms against the Roman state?
options: A desire to overthrow the Senate
A failure to obtain military support
Failure to be elected Tribune a third time, and plans to stop his colonisation
